intro: Pinalia retroflexa, commonly known as the retroflex pincushion, is a unique flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, spherical inflorescence. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded umbels. Its leaves are typically basal, forming a rosette, and the stems are often hairy. Pinalia retroflexa is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions.
